website_summaries.verdict: This steel stand has a tool tray for easy access to parts while you work.
pros: A basic bike repair stand with a manual clamp that fits tubes from 1.57" to 2.95" in diameter
Tool tray is a great feature
Stand height adjusts from 45.3" to 66.9" and weighs 13.8 lbs
cons: Some customers noted that the stand's main pole may spin when pressure is applied, making repairs challenging

customer_reviews.title: Easy and sturdy bike stand.
customer_reviews.text: New condo doesn't have workbench stand space so I went searching for a foldable stand and came across this one. It came fully assembled and set up quick. With light clamp force the non-marring head held my not-round tube bike with ease and also a regular round-tube mountain bike in any orientation that seemed helpful. Heavy-duty metal legs helps provide counterweight for the sturdy feel. Folds compact for travel if needed on the road. The height has good range as well so it will work for tall people too. All n all very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: RomanceImages

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Stand for Price
customer_reviews.text: My son ordered this unit a week or so ago and I figured it'd be a lightweight stand made primarily of plastic parts. Completely surprised by the materials used and overall design of the stand. The main tubes and support legs are all steel construction. Supports his road bike and our mountain bikes easily. Won't be able to support e-bike which is not surprising given their weight. He put it together in about 2 mins so definitely easy to construct and use. Definitely looks sturdy and should last for a long time with normal use. Cannot believe a product of this quality is sold at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Delivered Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Seems like decent quality for the price. Problem is it came without some parts. The tray is basically useless because it was delivered missing the hardware to attach it to the pole. Looks like a nut and bolt so I may be able to find something that will work at Home Depot but I’d rather it come complete as ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Z.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few days then the bolts and grip started to fail.  Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could strike the previous review, but I can change it. was excellent high quality, but only made it a few days and now the bike slips and starts to fall. Good news is that the bike stays attached, bad news is the tires almost touch the ground and no matter how many times I lift and tighten, it just starts to slide down again and again. Avoid Any way, if you need a stand and have been on the fence, just skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Affordable bike stand
customer_reviews.text: Long time was considered about bike stand. I have a few bikes and like upgrade them by switching parts around, trying to find right one for me. Stand pretty lite and compact, can be easy assembled in five minutes. Has few adjustments for height and angle of the arm. All fittings made of plastic and also arm made of tough plastic too, feels durable. Package include plate to handle tools while you working with the bike, very helpful. Now I know how to save time for bike rides,not for bike service, it is much easier to change parts and do all adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Vee

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Bad design, weak arm and locks, cheap plastic, red "lips" are loose and sliding on bike frame. Do not recommend to by this even for low price.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply boxed
customer_reviews.text: The stand was strong ... the plastic guides on the legs are very cheap plastic ... mine were shattered because the company packed it so poorly. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Pac

customer_reviews.title: Broken plastic feet.
customer_reviews.text: The plastic feet were damaged. this had to have happened before the stand was packaged as there were no broken pieces in the box and the box showed no damage.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT E BATES

customer_reviews.title: Functional for EBIKES, but excess weight can limit usability
customer_reviews.text: This stand works pretty well. My bike is 54 lbs due to being an ebike by Juiced. In particular I have the Cross Current S model. This stand is able to hold my bike off of the ground, but the horizontal arm doesn't seem to be able to tightened enough. No matter how tight I tried to make the horizontal arm, it will rotate counter-clockwise such that the front tire is in the air and the back tire is about 3 inches off the ground. The stand is still functional for cleaning my bike, but I do wish the tightening bracket for the horizontal arm was made of metal and not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M Phillips

customer_reviews.title: You CANNOT clamp the seat post on any bicycle.
customer_reviews.text: Just be aware of that before you purchase. It can hold heavy bicycles (I've tested up to 64lbs without any problems at all). However, because you have to hold the frame it makes it difficult with most bikes as there are wires running where you would have to use this to clamp to. If you have a section of the frame without exposed wires, you can't beat the price on this. It's definitely not as good as my main repair stand but great to have as a spare so you can easily wash 2 bicycles next to each other.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf

customer_reviews.title: Works great for working on my 54 pound e-bike
customer_reviews.text: I bought this stand for my 54 pound e-bike Haibike and has been working flawlessly, been real happy, very stable, allows me to work on cleaning and lubing the chain, also store the bike on the stand so it is always ready to ride. great value, seen some other reviews on this where people had problems with broken parts, I will say if you order one, check it right away because the shipping box is very light weight and I was lucky it all came in great shape and all parts were there. I would definitely recommend and buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: KEITH KOLB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality stand!
customer_reviews.text: Good stand, was on the cheaper side of available stands but, the quality is really good. First impression after assembling it was that this is sturdy, quality stand that will last a lifetime. If your considering this one have some peace of mind that you are not sacrificing quality for the lower price. Shipping was under a week as well. Very Happy!
customer_reviews.author: Vette racer

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and stable. I fix my bike by ...
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and stable. I fix my bike by putting it into the wall to fix the tire or brake sometime. But the front tire usually turns to another side so I always need other people to keep it straight away even fix something very simple. With this stand I do not need anyone to help me. Just hang it on the stand and tight it then you can do whatever you want.
customer_reviews.author: Vu Duy Thanh

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to save a buck instead of buying a big brand bike stand. Look, I’m not a pro cyclist with a tip of the line bike. I need something for basic bike maintenance that isn’t wobbly and flimsy. The metal on this stand is sold and the clamps can be tightened to the point where the bike won’t budge. There are some plastic parts but at this price it’s fine. I’ve tried a road bike and a kids mtb and both fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha Tomasito

customer_reviews.title: Good value, probably better for bikes less than 35lbs
customer_reviews.text: Pretty great for it’s price. I mainly use it to hold my road bike out of the way so I can park in a garage. It’s stable, but it doesn’t seem sturdy enough for the mountain bike I have. I haven’t used it to work on the bike but it seems it’d do a good job With the road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Even better than advertised with great low price.
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the lower-priced stands that proved to be the best choice. The clincher is I read the full description and found it should hold my wider Trek Domane-SL bars and IT DID! Fantastic stand for cleaning, greasing and making all repairs off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: John P. DERMODY

customer_reviews.title: Good option for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this stand 5 stars as the price point is good for occasional use. If you are working on bikes all the time, you might spring for something a little more durable. For me, I will probably use this a few times a year and so went with something functional but not too pricey. The height adjustment is good and holds on the bike fine. I didn't use the tool holder attachment. My workbench is close by so that was good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Schlenger

customer_reviews.title: surprising sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: The product came pretty much assembled. I was surprised at how sturdy and steady the bike is on the stand. The only negative I can comment on is the vertical clamp will not hold my (28 lb) bike at the same position for an extended time. There are multiple solutions for this such as a hose clamp.
customer_reviews.author: willie russell

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing worse than trying to work on a bike without a stand, there's just too much movement. I was a little bit skeptical because of the cheap price, but so far so good. It's been holding my 26" mountain bike as I've replaced the bottom bracket, crankset and made a bunch of adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Stable, works Very good
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the stand for a couple of weeks now. I use it to wash our MTB's and also to check derauliers and oil chains..... It works great, easy to use , or issues ... So far so good...!!
customer_reviews.author: fishingnut26

customer_reviews.title: Strong, works great....
customer_reviews.text: VERY sturdy, easy to set up, and comes with a handlebar support strut that keeps your rim STRAIGHT whilst working on it! EXCELLENT price, I really needed a second bike stand for working on motorized bicycles. I'm glad I took a chance on this, it's tough enough to hold the extra weight. Stores away easily, GREAT product.
customer_reviews.author: brian l swan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bike stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike stand for my road bike. The bike stand is very sturdy. When I first put my bike on the stand, I had the water bottle still attached to my bike, and the stand hold it like a champ. Going forward, I will be able to work on my bicycle at home. This is going to be a big money saver for me to work on my bike at home and get my hands dirty. I'm excited.
customer_reviews.author: LU HUAHSIN

customer_reviews.title: Decent but room to improve.
customer_reviews.text: Decent stand, heavy and sturdy seeming. I’ve only used it briefly as I just got it. I can see how other reviewers have broken them. Packaging could be much better. Really irritating that the nut to hold on the tool tray was missing from the packaging. I can get another at a hardware store but shouldn’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Johns

customer_reviews.title: BEST buy for this type of item
customer_reviews.text: If you want junk then don't buy this product because it most certainly is too well made to qualify as junk. For the price ($40) it is WELL made of heavy metal tubing and the clamp arm holds your bike securely AND it rotates to make it much easier to do maintenance on the bike. Would I buy two of them based upon the quality? Absolutely YES (but I won't because one is more then adequate). If you do purchase this item you will NOT be disappointed in the least.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Koral

customer_reviews.title: Not an everyday stand but .......
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend of mine who needs an occasional stand. I wouldn't use this as my everyday workstand but would be great as a "camping" or race day stand. Something compact that easy to store and take with you.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this is that it is cheap. Both in money and quality. Nothing tightens easily or well. Which means it is very difficult to keep your bike straight. Forget the tool attachment doesn’t work at all. I have owned an expensive Pedro stand which was heavy and difficult to set up but once in place worked perfectly. Sigh, you get what you pay for. My advice: don’t pay for this.
customer_reviews.author: apl

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, no wobble or drift, levels easily, clamps are solid. Had to wire brush and oil the threads on the top quick-release screw before it would budge but it operates smoothly now.
customer_reviews.author: Enkidu

customer_reviews.title: Excellent device for the price
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I need to keep my bikes in shape. Sturdy. Easy set-up.
customer_reviews.author: CoopDoc

customer_reviews.title: Good product and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Have used this now for several months and with a couple of unitizing it. Is very sturdy and adjustable. Holds the bikes both road and mountain upside down for cleaning and doing adjustments. is lightweight and folds up quickly and the top brace comes off easily for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Rogerkmiller

customer_reviews.title: Great stand!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is worrh every penny. It arrived yesterday, and I had it assembled in the garage in just a few minutes. It took longer to set the height and angle for my bike. I left the bike on it overnight to see if there would be any sag. It didn’t budge. So today I used it for its first cleanup/lube. This makes it sooo much easier, and the tool shelf is handy as well. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Great for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: Great for my purpose. I'll be using this as a launch pad base for model rocketry. The clamp is great for holding the launch rod/rail is the perfect orientation for loading and launch. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Monte J. Chester

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup and works great.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Holds my bike perfectly. My bike doesn't have a kick stand so this stand is perfect. I don't need to flip my bike upside down to work on it anymore. It's light and easy to setup. The tray is great. I don't worry about loosing nuts and bolts anymore either. Wish I bought this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: klee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Stable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very versatile & sturdy stand. I'm building an eBike & it's pretty heavy. I was concerned whether it could handle the weight. But no problem at all. Good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: 1Blkbird

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For this price. I think this is awesome. I put a 35 pound bike on it. Works fine. Not super sturdy. But it’s <$50!!
customer_reviews.author: Honeybadger

customer_reviews.title: Absolute junk.  Worst engineering ever.
customer_reviews.text: It literally broke the first 5 seconds. I put my MTB on it and the cheap plastic bracket at the bottom that actually holds all the weight cracked in half. I duck taped it so it better than new. I would not buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: ray mckay

customer_reviews.title: I had a 3-legged stand this replaced it is great stability with the bike clamped in
customer_reviews.text: I had a 3-legged stand this replaced it is great stability with the bike clamped in, but gave it 4 stars because it does not hold tension on bike to hold it in the position I want to work on like my old stand does.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wideman

customer_reviews.title: Item as described
customer_reviews.text: Works great! If working with an ebike it helps to have a 2nd person with you to adjust but not necessary.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: good deal
customer_reviews.text: The product seems well built and I've used it on crossover bikes as well as our tandem It functions well but I am concerned about the durability of the plastic fittings. For the price i believe it is a very good deal and would buy it again knowing what I know now. There was a broken foot when it arrived but I was able to repair it with some epoxy and it has really caused no problems. It is however disappointing to receive a broken item.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Back Saver!
customer_reviews.text: After using this bike stand for several weeks I can say it’s a sturdy stand and the tool tray attachment keeps you from looking all over for the tools you need to work on your bike. Everything it kept organized and in one place. No more bending over to replace that chain or adjust the brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob-Ashley B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice for the price. holds my bike securely. The tool tray is handy. I don't think there is any way this could tip over, thanks to it's wide base, short of someone intentionally pushing it.
customer_reviews.author: nonofyourbusiness

customer_reviews.title: Great stand
customer_reviews.text: I really needed a bike stand and this one is great. Easy to assemble and move around the house, indoors and out.
customer_reviews.author: kpluvs2laf

customer_reviews.title: Not good, not bad
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bike stand. The only problem is that the arm tends to bend down or swivel when you put a bike on the stand, even if you get it really tight. And my bike is lightweight aluminum. There's probably better out there, but this works for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Harrell

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE STAND.
customer_reviews.text: Quality stand! This thing is sturdy, you can also adjust the height and telescope it out further away from the stand. It spins 360 degrees. Couldn't be happier. Don't let the price fool you.
customer_reviews.author: Bunny Lord

customer_reviews.title: Weak
customer_reviews.text: Broke my 3rd time using it. I was lightly cleaning the derailleur system when my bike nearly fell on my head. Next time I'll just save my money for the name brand stand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike stand. It is sturdy and durable. It is very easy to adjust, and once adjusted, stays in place. One very minor complaint, and I mean minor, is the red plastic end-caps on the top jaw have a tendency to fall off after loosening the clamp to adjust or remove a bike frame. I guess they just need to be glued or taped in place. Like I said, just something very minor. Everything else is great. Very sturdy and durable, and to me, very worth the price. This stand has been in use for a little while. I am very pleased with this stand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid great bike stand
customer_reviews.text: Great bike stand. It was a difficult decision deciding which maintenance bike stand to select with the vast options on Amazon. I am extremely happy with this stand. It has a metal large tube solid construction and does not have any problem holding bikes at any angle. Plenty of versatility with this stand. I would highly recommend this bike stand.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Page

customer_reviews.title: Good stand
customer_reviews.text: Never had a bike stand but this one works great. I use it for my road and mountain bikes with no issues. I've had it for about a month and used often and still no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better on the back
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver and a must have if you work on bikes. It works on most all bikes it beats bending over on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: sgtfury83

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy enough for sure as my bike is only 23 ...
customer_reviews.text: No complaints at all. I'm not a pro bike mechanic and I didn't expect a high dollar heavy duty stand. It is sturdy enough for sure as my bike is only 23 lbs. It would be good with a heavier bike too. It's definitely good for the average cyclist to work on their bike.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great bike stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is perfect for me. I starting to work on my own bikes and it works... I’m no Professional bike mechanic and it does what It’s designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: This is a toy
customer_reviews.text: I should have flushed my money down the toilet, this thing is not strong enough to work on adult bikes
customer_reviews.author: Ian Mouer

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: it’s great. also unread some of the reviews that said the bike tips over, this isn’t possible when the kegs are extended which you do so by pushing down on the legs while lifting the stem. it could hold a motorcycle IMO. it’s beyond fantastic for the money especially.
customer_reviews.author: JD Roeder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Despite some of the other reviews about broken knobs etc this was delivered in first class condition and only needs the simplest of assembly. Fits together easily, collapses for storage easily too if you don’t want it up all the time. Huge flexibility in how you mount the bike to suit where you’re working and what you’re doing. Simply perfect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ZF

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent foldable bike stand. I have no problems with my hybrid and the mount remains sturdy. Folds up and out of the way when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: Why spend more and get the same results?
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt best purchase I've made for the bike. I'll have my bike securely clamped down in seconds. From cleaning to swapping wheels, I have yet to have an issue. Could the tool tray be better sure but it holds what I need and I can quickly adjust its placement. It's cheap and worth it, I have no clue why you'd spend more money to get the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Darmerderner

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works great for doing adjustments and repairs. I used to be a pro bike mechanic and now only do it when i need to on my own bikes. Compaired to the Park stands, it's not as nice... but for a heck of a lot less, it is stable and holds the bike in any position i need!
customer_reviews.author: Tak1024

customer_reviews.title: this is a great stand! Things move around a little on it
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is a great stand! Things move around a little on it, but you won't find a better stand at this price point. I do all of my own repairs, and this stand has not failed me. It does struggle to hold heavier bikes though....
customer_reviews.author: Badfish_2

customer_reviews.title: weak and breakable bike clamp
customer_reviews.text: The first time that I used this item the bottom side of the plastic clamp broke. Unfortunately, by that time, the 30 days return period had passed, so I'm now stuck with this semi-usable product. Even before the clamp broke, the hold on the bicycle was not tight enough and there was too much wiggle. There's potential in this stand; the base and stand are strong and sturdy. But at this point it's probably better to spend a couple extra bucks for a stand with a more substantial clamp.
customer_reviews.author: Ian McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Could be a be a bit better. Sags slightly under full weight loading
customer_reviews.text: Could be a be a bit better. Sags slightly under full weight loading, but not much. Clamps are not quite strong enough to hold heavy bikes w/o some slipping. Works well enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Timedoc

customer_reviews.title: Bicycle work stand
customer_reviews.text: I just received my bike stand. It was practically already assembled. In under 5 minutes it was ready to use. Looks plenty robust enough and everything was included.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Haskell

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the money
customer_reviews.text: The clamp is just plastic and is made for pretty thick tubes. I clamped it as tight as I could on my seatpost and didn't realize it was swiveling in the clamp ever so slightly. When I took it off, the paint and graphics on the seatpost were scuffed.
customer_reviews.author: Steven B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and built great
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and built great. My mountain bike is on it now. For the price there selling it. They could ask for more. Oh oh shouldn't say that.
customer_reviews.author: bryce knierim

customer_reviews.title: GOOD VALUE AND PERFORMS WELL  5-Stars!
customer_reviews.text: Works well and great customer service Was missing a nut but they sent one out promptly. Good value and performs well for my MTB needs.
customer_reviews.author: RoboCup

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: My modified e-bike way over 75 pounds. This handles it just fine. Just what I wanted. The only missing is a handlebar stabilizer. I will have to find another way to stabilize my handlebar.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony W. Hull

customer_reviews.title: Good bike stand. Clamps and adjustments slip under load
customer_reviews.text: Good bike stand. The only issue I have had is that the clamping of all of the parts is not super forceful or the parts that are clamped are kind of slippery. This means that if I clamp my bike in an off balance way, not at the center of mass, the clamp fails and the bike rotates while I am working on it, which can get frustrating. This is inconvenient for procedures like brake bleeds in which you want the bike oriented in a specific way.
customer_reviews.author: roberto barbier

customer_reviews.title: Not that great
customer_reviews.text: The arm that holds the bike twists. You have to have it perfectly balanced
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: materials
customer_reviews.text: I am not crazed with this purchase. the stand is light weight and not particularly steady. For the price I would give it three stars; for the mechanics of it 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Oh my gosh it’s great to use
customer_reviews.text: I just used the stand for the first time to wash my bike and degrease the chain. Oh my gosh it’s great to use!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Fae

customer_reviews.title: Good stand at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and was very easy to set up. It holds my 35lb recumbent bike nicely, even though it has a 2" main tube. So far, though, I've had to rest the front wheel on a bass amp to keep the bike from tipping. This is really just a balance issue, not a fault in the stand, as there is only one spot on the frame that will accept the clamp (cables run all but about four inches of the frame). Good product at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Mongofan

customer_reviews.title: Great stand!
customer_reviews.text: This stand exceeded my expectations. Very strong and well built. Is able to hold my large Ghost Kato FS 5 by the seat post and rotate to any angle. I would definitely recommend this stand. The one downside, the rubber/plastic bumpers on the clamp have a tendency to fall off, but nothing a little adhesive won't fix.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Very sturdy and perfect for working on the bikes. My bike is 35lbs and the stand holds the bike perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Damian L

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC!!!!! Very sturdy, easy to assembly, and folds up compactly. I wish I would have bought this many years ago. It makes working on your bicycle SOOOO much easier!
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: great bike stand.
customer_reviews.text: This is very easy to use, is sturdy, and makes working on bikes MUCH easier. Light weight and folds up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ostler

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The quality is very high. I haven’t put my bike on it yet because I’m too busy to clean it. Nevertheless I think it will hold very well. I’m pretty mechanically inclined and appreciate quality products
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: The quality for the price is nothing short of amazing. Used some carbon grip on the top rotating arm to help hold the weight with out dropping.
customer_reviews.author: JRFlurry

customer_reviews.title: Instruction on tray
customer_reviews.text: Receive an item a few days before expectation. Everything seem staple when putting it together. At first I was having a hard time putting a tray onto the post. But I figure out that all you have to do is to turn the bolt the other side around and that do the trick. Hope that help.
customer_reviews.author: Peerachat

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this stand. Great buy at a very reasonable price. I highly recommend this stand to anyone who loves their bike & saving money not buying crap products.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Bikes moved too much.
customer_reviews.text: Allowed bikes to swivel and move too much, but this is solidly constructed otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Snooty Lady

customer_reviews.title: Tighten upper swivel point
customer_reviews.text: I like my stand and have used it twice to wash and service my bikes. It works well but you have to tighten the upper clamp down tight so bike doesn’t tilt. Other than that works well. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: You really need to tighten ALL of the hardware for it to be stable, even stuff that isn't obvious. Once that's done, it works well. Perfect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holds 29” MTB Easy
customer_reviews.text: Great for light and occasional work. Holds my 29” MTB (large) for all the maintenance I performed.
customer_reviews.author: Luis E.

customer_reviews.title: Solid...Strong...Durable
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the durability of this stand...Perfect....thanks
customer_reviews.author: John A.

customer_reviews.title: Works as Listed
customer_reviews.text: Bike stand held my old heavy mountain bike with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bruns

customer_reviews.title: Not good for heavier bicycles
customer_reviews.text: It’s a well built stand however I notice that the stand doesn’t hold my bike level when on it. When fully clamped down the bike stil twist on a angle
customer_reviews.author: glen

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for light use; Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried this wouldn't hold up but seems to be just strong enough for a weekend warrior. Worth the price for a casual user.
customer_reviews.author: Pb

customer_reviews.title: This is a very sturdy, and well made product
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy, and well made product, for a very good price. I bought for my husband, who enjoys working on his bicycle, and he couldn't be any happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works will - just what I wanted - folds easily
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Eggo

customer_reviews.title: Beware the clamp size
customer_reviews.text: If your bike has fenders, beware. The clamp that holds the bike post is too big to fit between the post and fender . . . and will not clamp on a smaller post; like the seat post. Otherwise, the product is hefty enough for my repair and cleaning purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Going All Out!

customer_reviews.title: My son says it holds his Giant Reign 2 Mtn bike just fine. The clamp is sturdy and the stand is ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made for how in expensive it was. My son says it holds his Giant Reign 2 Mtn bike just fine. The clamp is sturdy and the stand is stable.
customer_reviews.author: globug

customer_reviews.title: Arrived busted. UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Shipper offered to replace feet that were broken Came with two broken feet. Feet are made of plastic and it looks like they snapped off during shipping. Otherwise it works ok.
customer_reviews.author: humanzookeeper

customer_reviews.title: Stable and strong.
customer_reviews.text: This work stand is very stable, strong and portable. It easily clamps my 3 very different types of bicycles. My only issue was that one of the plastic feet on the end of the four legs was broken in shipment. I was able to repair it with some epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Walter

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality plastic product . Save your bike DONT BUY. I am returning this crap.
customer_reviews.text: Mounted bike which is about 34lb and the plastic holder cracks and the bike fell off.
customer_reviews.author: xyzzy2005

customer_reviews.title: Get it while they last
customer_reviews.text: It’s all I hope it would be after 25 years of procrastination. I like the adjustable heights and knobs and the tool tray tops it off.
customer_reviews.author: Carl  Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold bike in place
customer_reviews.text: Came broke in the box. Still tried to use it but very cheaply made and could not hold the bike without it falling.
customer_reviews.author: Saisha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and store away
customer_reviews.text: This stand is really easy to assemble and once folded up it doesn’t take up much space. Very strong and sturdy. I can angle the bike however I want and the clamp holds all shapes of frame tubing. The height adjustable tool tray is a nice touch as well, perfect for placing my Allen keys and wrenches while working on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality product that works exactly how it is intended to work.
customer_reviews.author: Dan and Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest rack, but better than expected, for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great for people who work on their bikes every now & then. It could be a little sturdier & take up a little less space. It’s a great value.
customer_reviews.author: John Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Stable and good material
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the bike stand. Holds my gt bike steady and the stand is made of good material.
customer_reviews.author: SHABU

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The arm bent as soon as I put my bike on it. You have to hold your bike up while you turn the knob for about 20 seconds to lock the bike into place by the seat. You cannot change the angle of the bike. Wouldn't recommend
customer_reviews.author: Texas 2 Step

customer_reviews.title: Prefect for repairing your bike !!
customer_reviews.text: Great item just what I needed to help repair my bike before the springtime, It’s sturdy and holds my bike it all positions to fix it. Can’t wait to ride again
customer_reviews.author: Derek

product_meta.title: MVPower Pro Mechanic Bike Repair Stand Adjustable Height Bicycle Maintenance Rack Workstand with Tool Tray, Telescopic Arm Cycle
product_meta.description:
▶Description:
✿MVPOWER bike repair stand could be used for storing your bike off the floor,great accessory for bicycle workshop, club and cycling lover.

▶About US:
If there are any problems about the purchase, pls contact our customer service directly (Rather than Amazon Consumer Service). Click into (Sold by) "Green glasses" and then click" Ask a question".. We would rely you in 12 hours and provide you best solution!

▶NOTICE/No Nut of Tool Tray:
✿The original design of tool tray is without the nut,which could guarantee easily to tighten the tray by ONLY the bolt.
✿USAGE: pls take attention to the PICTURE 9 of the product.(If any question could feel free to contact us)

▶Features:
✔High quality support jaws grip the bike securely so no damage will be caused to the bike paintwork.
✔Sturdy frame supports and grips the bike securely,soft clamp jaws to protect your frame from scratches.
✔Heavy duty construction with 4 folding legs for extra stability,360 Degrees rotating clamp allows your bike to be held in any position.

▶Specifications:
●Easy to assemble
●Includes Tool tray
●Maximum capacity:50kg/110lbs
●Net Weight: about 12.2lbs(5.55kg)
●Tool tray size:12"*6.9"/30.5*17.5cm
●Material: high quality iron+plastic
●Adjustable height from 45.3" to 66.9"(1.15m-1.70m)

▶Package Include:
1*bicycle repair stand
feature_bullets: HIGH QUALITY MATERIAL:Made of premium iron and plastic,this bike stand is sturdy enough to support your bike,the heavy duty construction and 4 legs base make servicing and cleaning your bike much easier.

ADJUSTABLE CLAMP:360 degrees rotating clamp allows your bike to be held in any position,the two pivots and height adjustment can provide maximum flexibility for bike repair and the clamp has rubber grippers so it will not damage your bike.

HUMANIZATION DESIGN:Built with a tool tray,the tools you need can be organized in order, and this bike repair stand is collapsible and lightweight so you can bring it with you to anywhere as you want.
EASY TO INTALL:This bicycle stand is easy to assemble and all instructions, tools and hardware are included.
BIKE STAND SIZE:Telescoping stand adjusts from 45.3" to 66.9"(1.15m-1.7m),Clamp is suitable for frame tubing from 40mm to 75mm(1.57"-2.95") diameter.
